verses.verse: (1 David after he had been in great danger by Saul in the desert of Ziph, made this Psalm.3 Wherein he giveth thanks to God for his wonderful deliverance, in whose mercies he trusted, even in the midst of his miseries.9 Prophesying the destruction of Godâ€™s enemies:11 And contrariwise happiness to all them that trust in the Lord. O God, thou art my God, early will I seek thee: my soul (Though he was both hungry and in great distress, yet he made God his sufficiency and above all meat and drink.) thirsteth for thee: my flesh longeth greatly after thee in a barren and dry land without water:
Thus (In this misery I exercise myself in the contemplation of thy power and glory, as if I were in the Sanctuary.) I behold thee as in the Sanctuary, when I behold thy power and thy glory.
For thy loving-kindness is better than life: therefore my lips shall praise thee.
Thus will I magnify thee all my life, and lift up mine hands in thy Name.

My soul shall be satisfied, as with (The remembrance of thy favor is more sweet unto me than all the pleasures and dainties of the world.) marrow and fatness, and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips,
When I remember thee on my bed, and when I think upon thee in the night watches.
Because thou hast been mine helper, therefore under the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
My soul (He assureth himself by the Spirit of God to have the gift of constancy.) cleaveth unto thee: for thy right hand upholdeth me.
Therefore they that seek my soul to destroy it, they shall go into the lowest parts of the earth.

(He prophecieth of the destruction of Saul and them that take his part, whose bodies shall not be buried, but be devoured with wild beasts.) They shall cast him down with the edge of the sword, and they shall be a portion for foxes.

But the king shall rejoice in God, and all that (All that swear by God aright or profess him, shall rejoice in this worthy king.) swear by him shall rejoice in him: for the mouth of them that speak lies, shall be stopped.
